So as not to arouse suspicion, Lupin chose

12755.27.text:

12759.18.text:

12763.84.text:

12769.32.text:
On the confines of the forest, the little

12773.36.text:

12778.32.text:

12783.40.text: high, and the river hugs it all round."

12785.98.text:

12790.29.text:

12798.74.text:

12802.75.text:

12807.01.text:

12811.07.text:

12814.35.text:

13259.54.text:

Lupin raised his eyes to Clarisse. She was

"Masher," he said, "get a strong rope, but

13319.85.text:

13324.19.text:

13328.65.text:

It was difficult to find the material for

13332.57.text:

13340.00.text:

13372.34.text:
Clarisse also had taken a seat in the boat.
He said to her:

13376.57.text:
"Until we meet again. And, above all, don't

13386.59.text:
"Why, remember the Sire de Tancarville! It

13390.56.text:
his object, with his true love in his arms,

13397.95.text:
She made no reply. She seized his hand and

13402.96.text:
He put his foot on the ladder and made sure

13408.76.text: He soon reached the top rung.

13415.01.text:
the excessive steepness, and developing, mid-way,

13420.26.text:
Fortunately, here and there were little hollows,

13425.21.text:

But twice those stones gave way and he slipped;

13430.67.text:
and twice he firmly believed that all was

13436.01.text:
He was worn out, felt quite ready to throw

13440.36.text:
really worth while for him to expose himself
to such danger:

13443.74.text:
"I say!" he thought. "Seems to me you're showing

13449.30.text:
the enterprise? Then Daubrecq will babble

13453.76.text:

13458.66.text:
The long rope which he had fastened round

13462.40.text:
and fatigue. He fixed one of the ends to the

13467.06.text:
all the way down the ascent, so that he could

13472.12.text:
Then he once more clutched at the rough surface

13476.19.text:

13482.04.text:

13486.49.text:
so distinct that it seemed as though he were

13492.11.text:
And he remembered the Sire de Tancarville,

13496.71.text:

13500.94.text:

13511.22.text:
And he climbed... he climbed... He had climbed

13516.64.text:

Madly, he redoubled his efforts, raised himself

13569.80.text:

13574.34.text:
deep, which dug into the wall of the cliff

Arsene. I often receive a bright, chatty,

24450.29.text:
"She and her little Jacques are living with
them."

24457.31.text:
Lupin hesitated for a few moments and then
said with a smile:

24461.05.text:
"My dear fellow, I will let you into a secret
that will make me seem ridiculous in your

24465.87.text:
eyes. But you know that I have always been
as sentimental as a schoolboy and as silly

24470.09.text:
as a goose. Well, on the evening when I went
back to Clarisse Mergy and told her the news

24474.15.text:
of the day—part of which, for that matter,
she already knew—I felt two things very

24478.99.text:
thoroughly. One was that I entertained for
her a much deeper feeling than I thought;

24484.03.text:
the other that she, on the contrary, entertained
for me a feeling which was not without contempt,

24489.06.text:
not without a rankling grudge nor even a certain
aversion."

24494.50.text:
"Why? Because Clarisse Mergy is an exceedingly
honest woman and because I am... just Arsene

24502.37.text:
"Dear me, yes, an attractive bandit, a romantic
and chivalrous cracksman, anything you please.

24509.25.text:
For all that, in the eyes of a really honest
woman, with an upright nature and a well-balanced

24514.08.text: mind, I am only the merest riff-raff."

24517.31.text:
I saw that the wound was sharper than he was
willing to admit, and I said:

24523.22.text:
"I even believe," he said, in a jesting tone,
"that I asked her to marry me. After all,

24528.72.text:
I had saved her son, had I not?... So... I
thought. What a rebuff!... It produced a coolness

24540.92.text:
"Oh, certainly! But it required the consolations
of one Italian, two Americans, three Russians,

24546.71.text:
a German grand-duchess and a Chinawoman to
do it!"

24551.94.text:
"After that, so as to place an insuperable
barrier between myself and her, I got married."

24557.19.text: "Nonsense! You got married, you, Arsene Lupin?"

24561.97.text:
"Married, wedded, spliced, in the most lawful
fashion. One of the greatest names in France.

24567.44.text:
An only daughter. A colossal fortune... What!
You don't know the story? Well, it's worth

24573.16.text:
And, straightway, Lupin, who was in a confidential
vein, began to tell me the story of his marriage

24578.62.text:
to Angelique de Sarzeau-Vendome, Princesse
de Bourbon-Conde, to-day Sister Marie-Auguste,

But, after the first few words, he stopped,
as though his narrative had suddenly ceased

24592.12.text: to interest him, and he remained pensive.

24599.26.text:

Is it Daubrecq's secret receptacle, his glass

24609.66.text: "Nothing, I tell you... only a memory."

24614.26.text:
"Yes!... Yes, a delightful memory even. It
was at night, off the Ile de Re, on the fishing-smack

24619.83.text:
in which Clarisse and I were taking Gilbert
away.... We were alone, the two of us, in

24624.22.text:
the stern of the boat... And I remember ... I
talked... I spoke words and more words...

24630.52.text:
I said all that I had on my heart... And then...
then came silence, a perturbing and disarming

24639.30.text:
"Well, I swear to you that the woman whom
I took in my arms that night and kissed on

24643.85.text:
the lips—oh, not for long: a few seconds

24649.53.text:

24653.30.text:

24658.31.text:

24666.12.text: He was silent once more. Then he whispered:

24669.62.text:
"Clarisse... Clarisse... On the day when I
am tired and disappointed and weary of life,

24676.64.text:
I will come to you down there, in your little
Arab house ... in that little white house,

24681.33.text: Clarisse, where you are waiting for me..."
